title: Jesus My All
author: John Newton (1725-1807)
presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8

v1: Why should I fear the darkest hour,
Or tremble at the tempter's pow'r?
Jesus vouchsafes to be my tow'r.
v2: Though hot the fight, why quit the field,
Why must I either fly or yield,
Since Jesus is my mighty shield?
v3: When creature comforts fade and die,
Worldlings may weep, but why should I?
Jesus still lives, and still is nigh.
v4: Though all the flocks and herds were dead,
My soul a famine need not dread,
For Jesus is my living bread.
v5: I know not what may soon betide,
Or how my wants shall be supplied;
But Jesus knows, and will provide.
v6: Though sin would fill me with distress,
The throne of grace I dare address,
v7: Tho' faint my prayers and cold my love,
My steadfast hope shall not remove,
v8: Against me earth and hell combine;
But on my side is pow'r divine;
Jesus is all, and He is mine.
